required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of the Effect of Fostamatinib Twice Daily on Blood Pressure in Patients With Rheumatoid Arthritis
clinical_study.official_title: OSKIRA-ABPM: A Multi-Centre, Randomised, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel Group Study of the Effect of Fostamatinib 100 mg Twice Daily on 24-hour Ambulatory Blood Pressure in Patients With Rheumatoid Arthritis

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effect of fostamatinib compared to placebo on ambulatory blood pressure in patients with active rheumatoid arthritis who are taking a disease-modifying anti-rheumatic drug (DMARD).
The study will last for 57 days.

detailed_description.textblock: OSKIRA-ABPM: A Multi-Centre, Randomised, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel Group Study of the Effect of Fostamatinib 100 mg Twice Daily on 24-hour Ambulatory Blood Pressure in Patients with Rheumatoid Arthritis

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in 24-hour Mean Ambulatory SBP
primary_outcome.description: ANCOVA=analysis of covariance, BID=twice daily, FAS=full analysis set, IP=investigational product, SBP=systolic blood pressure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in 24-hour Mean Ambulatory DBP
secondary_outcome.description: ANCOVA=analysis of covariance, BID=twice daily, DBP=diastolic blood pressure, FAS=full analysis set, IP=investigational product.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Mean Daytime and Night-time SBP and DBP by Ambulatory Blood Pressure Monitoring
secondary_outcome.description: ANCOVA=analysis of covariance, BID=twice daily, DBP=diastolic blood pressure, FAS=full analysis set, IP=investigational product, SBP=systolic blood pressure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Mean Awake SBP and DBP by Ambulatory Blood Pressure Monitoring
secondary_outcome.description: ANCOVA=analysis of covariance, BID=twice daily, DBP=diastolic blood pressure, FAS=full analysis set, IP=investigational product, SBP=systolic blood pressure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Mean Sleeping SBP and DBP by Ambulatory Blood Pressure Monitoring
secondary_outcome.description: ANCOVA=analysis of covariance, BID=twice daily, DBP=diastolic blood pressure, FAS=full analysis set, IP=investigational product, SBP=systolic blood pressure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Clinic SBP and DBP
secondary_outcome.description: Blood pressure was measured in the clinic using an automated blood pressure machine (oscillometric method). Three separate measurements were taken 2 to 5 minutes apart and the mean of the 2nd and 3rd measurements calculated. ANCOVA=analysis of covariance, BID=twice daily, DBP=diastolic blood pressure, FAS=full analysis set, IP=investigational product, SBP=systolic blood pressure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Morning Pre-dose Home SBP and DBP
secondary_outcome.description: ANCOVA=analysis of covariance, BID=twice daily, DBP=diastolic blood pressure, FAS=full analysis set, IP=investigational product, SBP=systolic blood pressure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Evening Post-dose Home SBP and DBP
secondary_outcome.description: ANCOVA=analysis of covariance, BID=twice daily, DBP=diastolic blood pressure, FAS=full analysis set, IP=investigational product, SBP=systolic blood pressure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Completion/Discontinuation to Follow-up in Clinical Measurement of SBP and DBP
secondary_outcome.description: BID=twice daily, DBP=diastolic blood pressure, FAS=full analysis set, IP=investigational product, SBP=systolic blood pressure.

ANCOVA=analysis of covariance, BID=twice daily, DAS28-CRP=Disease Activity Score based on a count of swollen and tender joints (out of 28 joints), blood test measures of inflammation (C-reactive protein [CRP]) and the patient's own assessment, FAS=full analysis set, IP=investigational product. Scores can take any positive value with a lower value indicative of a better clinical condition. Mean changes from baseline in DAS28-CRP score are shown at each visit and are presented as decreases from baseline (defined as baseline minus post-baseline) with larger changes indicating a better clinical condition.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and female patients aged 18 or over diagnosed with rheumatoid arthritis after the age of 16
- Active rheumatoid arthritis defined as: ≥4 swollen joints and ≥4 tender/painful joints (from 28 joint count) and either erythrocyte sedimentation rate ≥28 mm/h, or C-reactive protein ≥10 mg/L.
- Currently taking one of the following disease-modifying anti-rheumatic drugs: methotrexate, sulfasalazine, hydroxychloroquine or chloroquine.
- Patients without essential hypertension or with essential hypertension if their blood pressure is controlled (<140/90 mmHg) with anti-hypertensive medications being stable at least 4 weeks prior to randomisation.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Females who are pregnant or breastfeeding.
- Certain inflammatory conditions (other than rheumatoid arthritis), connective tissue diseases or chronic pain disorders
- History of liver problems that have required previous investigations
- Evidence of tuberculosis infection
- Conditions that preclude or render difficult the 24-hour ambulatory blood pressure monitoring technique.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A total of 266 patients were enrolled.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 131 patients failed screening.

milestone.title: Randomised But Did Not Receive Treatment

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Dev. of study specific discont. criteria

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in 24-hour Mean Ambulatory SBP
outcome.description: ANCOVA=analysis of covariance, BID=twice daily, FAS=full analysis set, IP=investigational product, SBP=systolic blood pressure.
outcome.population: The FAS includes those randomised patients who received at least 1 dose of IP. Patients were analysed by randomised treatment in accordance with the intention to treat principle.The analysis population for each endpoint includes patients from the FAS still on IP at 4 weeks and with a valid measurement for this type of blood pressure assessment.

outcome.title: DAS28-CRP Improvement
outcome.description: ANCOVA=analysis of covariance, BID=twice daily, DAS28-CRP=Disease Activity Score based on a count of swollen and tender joints (out of 28 joints), blood test measures of inflammation (C-reactive protein [CRP]) and the patient’s own assessment, FAS=full analysis set, IP=investigational product. Scores can take any positive value with a lower value indicative of a better clinical condition. Mean changes from baseline in DAS28-CRP score are shown at each visit and are presented as decreases from baseline (defined as baseline minus post-baseline) with larger changes indicating a better clinical condition.
outcome.population: The FAS includes those randomised patients who received at least 1 dose of IP. Patients were analysed by randomised treatment in accordance with the intention to treat principle. The analysis population for each endpoint includes those patients from the FAS who were still on IP at 4 weeks and had a valid measurement for this type of assessment.

measure.title: DAS28-CRP Improvement
measure.description: ANCOVA=analysis of covariance, BID=twice daily, DAS28-CRP=Disease Activity Score based on a count of swollen and tender joints (out of 28 joints), blood test measures of inflammation (C-reactive protein [CRP]) and the patient’s own assessment, FAS=full analysis set, IP=investigational product. Scores can take any positive value with a lower value indicative of a better clinical condition. Mean changes from baseline in DAS28-CRP score are shown at each visit and are presented as decreases from baseline (defined as baseline minus post-baseline) with larger changes indicating a better clinical condition.
measure.population: The FAS includes those randomised patients who received at least 1 dose of IP. Patients were analysed by randomised treatment in accordance with the intention to treat principle. The analysis population for each endpoint includes those patients from the FAS who were still on IP at 4 weeks and had a valid measurement for this type of assessment.

analysis.groups_desc: Improvement from baseline at Day 29. Non-responder imputation has been applied following premature withdrawal, or any dose of background disease modifying antirheumatic drug increased or any other RA treatment initiated including DMARDs, anti-TNFs or other biologics, or receiving any parenteral steroids, or for patients with no post baseline data.
analysis.p_value_desc: Inc. baseline (covariate); treatment, region, prior failure to biologic disease modifying antirheumatic drug & baseline antihypertensive use (factors)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review and comment on results communications prior to publication or presentation. Sponsor will be allowed a review period of at least 60 days from submission but can request that the submission be delayed for an additional 90 days from the date of Sponsor’s request.
